intro: Haplopappus lignumviridis, commonly known as the green wood dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant features alternate, linear leaves that are usually covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, followed by small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Haplopappus lignumviridis is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
